info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 6:40PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Big Horn and central Yellowstone Counties through 715 PM MDT... At 640 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Shepherd to 15 miles southeast of Huntley. Movement was north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shepherd, Huntley, Worden, Ballantine and Pompeys Pillar. This advisory does not include the city of Billings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
